abstract.text: Synchronously creates a cube texture resource from an equirectangular image.

inlineContent.text: A unique name for syncing the texture resource across the network.
The name is empty if you don’t include one.
The sampling quality the initializer applies as it generates the cube texture.
The length of the cube’s sides, in pixels.
, RealityKit computes the size based on the equirectangular image’s dimensions.
RealityKit clamps the value to the source image’s height.
For best results, pass values that are one-third of the cubeʻs width or less.
A configuration for generating the texture.
with this method blocks the main actor because it’s synchronous, so only call it from a command-line application.
The method can stall a regular app, which makes it visibly hitch, and the system terminates an app if its UI becomes unresponsive.
for an example that demonstrates how to safely load content.
RealityKit samples the source equirectangular image at the specified quality level to generate

code: if let source = CGImageSourceCreateWithURL(url as CFURL, nil),
// Create a cube texture from the image.
// Create an environment resource from the cube texture.
// Assign the environment to an image-based light component.

abstract.text: Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
An object that holds texture resource creation options.
The dimensions of the cube texture.
An object for controlling the texture-sampling quality.
Asynchronously creates a cube texture resource from face images.
Synchronously creates a cube texture resource from face images.
Synchronously creates a cube texture resource from an equirectangular image.
Asynchronously creates a cube texture resource from an equirectangular image.
Synchronously creates a cube texture resource from a 2D image of cube faces.
Asynchronously creates a cube texture resource from a 2D image of cube faces.

Asynchronously creates a cube texture resource from a pixel Metal buffer or data.
Asynchronously loads a texture resource from a bundle.
A bitmap image or image mask.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
